subtasks: Sit on the combine's seat

Use the forward and reverse gears to navigate fields

Check for crop debris and clean equipment as required
Use the engine controls to start and stop the machine

Monitor the weight of crops being loaded
Close the unloading mechanism once the trailer is full
Wait for the trailer to be unloaded before resuming harvest
Inspect the combine for any visible damage
Test the combine's mechanical functions
Lubricate moving parts of the combine
Check and adjust the combine's ventilation system
Clean the combine's cab and external surfaces
Sit on the tractor's seat
Operate the steering wheel or control levers
Use foot pedals for speed and direction
Engage the transmission to select gears
Apply the brakes when stopping
Manage the tractor's tilt for field operations

Connect the pickup's hydraulic lines to the combine
Program the pickup's settings for crop type
Adjust the pickup's speed relative to the combine

Adjust combine settings based on real-time crop conditions
Check the grain grade and cleanliness
Inspect the field for any leftover plant parts
Note down observation results for record-keeping
